intro: Philadelphus tenuifolius var. latipetalus, commonly known as the broad-petaled mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features compound leaves with ovate to elliptic leaflets that are typically 2–4 inches long. The plant produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a versatile addition to gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
